description: Return real-time flight prices and availabilities.

blocks.name: searchSingleTrip
blocks.description: This endpoint returns information about single trip.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your ApiKey obtained from Google Developer Console.

args.name: origin
args.info: The departure city. 3-digit code IATA format, for example: BOS - Boston

args.name: destination
args.info: The city of arrival. 3-digit code IATA format, for example: BOS - Boston

args.name: passengersAdultCount
args.info: The number of passengers that are adults.

args.name: passengersChildCount
args.info: The number of passengers that are children.

args.name: fromDate
args.info: The date of departure. Format:  YYYY-mm-dd. Example: 2016-12-20

args.name: toDate
args.info: The return flight date. Format:  YYYY-mm-dd. Example: 2016-12-20

args.name: maxPrice
args.info: Do not return solutions that cost more than this price. The currency is specified in ISO-4217. The format, in regex, is [A-Z] {3} \d+(\.\d+)?

args.name: refundable
args.info: Return only solutions with refundable fares.

args.name: solutions
args.info: The number of solutions to return, maximum 500.

blocks.name: searchTrips
blocks.description: This endpoint returns a list of flights.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your ApiKey obtained from Google Developer Console.

args.name: fields
args.info: Selector specifying a subset of fields to include in the response. For more information, see the partial response documentation. Use for better performance..

args.name: quotaUser
args.info: Alternative to userIp. Lets you enforce per-user quotas from a server-side application even in cases when the user's IP address is unknown. This can occur, for example, with applications that run cron jobs on App Engine on a user's behalf. You can choose any arbitrary string that uniquely identifies a user, but it is limited to 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided. Learn more about capping usage.

args.name: userIp
args.info: IP address of the end user for whom the API call is being made. Lets you enforce per-user quotas when calling the API from a server-side application. Learn more about capping usage.

args.name: passengersKind
args.info: Identifies this as a passenger count object, representing the number of passengers. Value: the fixed string qpxexpress#passengerCounts.

args.name: passengersAdultCount
args.info: The number of passengers that are adults.

args.name: passengersChildCount
args.info: The number of passengers that are children.

args.name: passengersInfantInLapCount
args.info: The number of passengers that are infants travelling in the lap of an adult.

args.name: passengersInfantInSeatCount
args.info: The number of passengers that are infants each assigned a seat.

args.name: passengersSeniorCount
args.info: The number of passengers that are senior citizens.

args.name: slices
args.info: The slices that make up the itinerary of this trip. An example of a slice: {"kind": "qpxexpress#sliceInput", "origin": "BOS", "destination": "LAX", "date": "2017-10-10"}

structure.name: kind
structure.info: Currently should be equal to qpxexpress#sliceInput

args.name: maxPrice
args.info: Do not return solutions that cost more than this price. The currency is specified in ISO-4217. The format, in regex, is [A-Z] {3} \d+(\.\d+)?

args.name: saleCountry
args.info: IATA country code representing the point of sale. This determines the "equivalent amount paid" currency for the ticket.

args.name: ticketingCountry
args.info: IATA country code representing the point of ticketing.

args.name: refundable
args.info: Return only solutions with refundable fares.

args.name: solutions
args.info: The number of solutions to return, maximum 500.
